SENT.plain: A 12-year-old boy with a history of a mewing cry after birth, severe mental retardation, Marfanoid arachnodactyly, general osteomalacia and multiple bone fractures was found to have a de novo 5p;12q chromosomal translocation
The karyotypes of other examined family members are normal

The manifestations of cri du chat syndrome are explained by the loss of a small segment of 5p15 which is responsible for the major stigmata of the syndrome, and the abnormalities of the osseous system may be the results of untreated vitamin D resistant rickets
